alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 6:35AM EST until January 07 at 12:25PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. The water level reaches the top of the Old Balls Ferry Road boat ramp...just upstream and rightbank from the Georgia Highway 57 bridge. Minor flooding of woodlands near the river occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 AM EST Friday was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 8.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.7 feet on 01/06/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
